0.Pros: Worked around my hours and was able to allow me time off when needed
0.Cons: I felt like I was given the opportunity to move up in the company

1.Pros: Free food sometimes which is a plus
1.Cons: High pressure, customers rude to you

2.Pros: Stability, and plenty to learn if you apply yourself. Flexible hours, should never be a lack of full time hours as long as you apply yourself. You can always transfer to a different area, mist areas are always hiring.
2.Cons: Repetitive, stressful, low pay, high employee turn over in most areas. You always need a shower if you work here, both before and after work, mornings are early, most areas don't pay much above minimum wage.

3.Cons: Good place to work part time only

4.Summary: "Low level, fairly easy, can be gross, sometimes frustrating"
4.Pros: Doesn't require that much skill, if your good at your job then plenty of hours, half off food, free soft drinks
4.Cons: Very greasy, not the smartest people, weight gain, customers can be mean, you have to deal with a lot of gross stuff and get your hands dirty

5.Pros: Flexibility in schedule, perfect for parents, can call out as needed usually plenty of coverage
5.Cons: Large work load that is shared inconsistently among who is on shift depending upon when your shift is. They expect 3 employees to do the work of 7+. Results in unhappy customers and long wait times.

6.Pros: McDonalds had a decent training program and the job wasn't that difficult. They were flexible with my schedule since I was still in school.
6.Cons: Many of the employees were not fluent in English which posed a language barrier. They rarely gave out raises and when they did it was like 10 cents.

7.Pros: I loved the crew I worked with and we all got along
7.Cons: Some things would be left undone for the next shift to do and I didn't like it

8.Cons: hard to get days off and busy hours

9.Pros: i took breaks literally whenevs, they let me eat.
9.Cons: they trip about punching in and out. you cant ride no clock
